text: We estimate that a research program into advanced solar cells has an expected benefit of about $125 billion and a cost of about $8 billion. We estimate the eventual cost to be 4 ¢/kWh, with the same greenhouse gas and pollution costs as other forms of solar, and that it will take 10 years to commercialize new technology, with spending at the same $830 million per year as suggested by a wave energy program. See our analysis of research and development for more information.
